column5: Hi guys Curious if you can help in referring a parking lot in downtown Toronto? Was lucky enough to get a couple tix for tomorrow's hockey game so my son and I are heading down from near Orillia..I have been down several times for different reasons(Jays games etc) but would also like to go to the Hockey Hall of Fame as well while we are down there..I was just wondering if anyone could refer a 'good parking lot'  ( was also looking at underneath the HHOF at Brookfield Place?..I know it will be busy after the game so a short walk is okay too to avoid the crowd and get back on the QEW/Gardiner... thanks guys Richard  Happy fishing to those going on the weekend.....

Another option would be TTC.   Park at Yorkdale mall-free. Ride the rocket right down to Union Station and it is a short walk to the HHoF and back to the ACC for the game.   If you drive down there are a lot of underground lots in the area.
yeah that might be an option..havent done that for years thx!

My 1st Leaf game in 1981 with my dad was a series of firsts.  Trip to T.O. from North Bay  Subway ride  Street car ride  Golden Griddle right down the street from the Gardens  pancakes for dinner  NHL game  Maple Leaf Gardens   Man when those tv lights came on after the anthem I nearly crapped myself... The ice was so white, the uniforms so bright.   Priceless... thanks dad.
I do this all the time for Jays games and anything I go to the city for. Beats the traffic and it's cheaper then driving all the way there and paying for parking.
I park right @ union station almost underneath the tracks. Gotta get there early though
Another vote for the Yorkdale Mall idea, Park on the east side near the overhead walkway leading from the mall to the TTC . (by Allen Rd.)
thanks guys, I think that is what we'll do!
